definition: to start sth new or original (idiom); to break a new path/to break fresh ground
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: This suggestion is new, and out of the common road.
sentences.chinese: 這個建議是新的，而且是別開生面的。

sentences.english: This is a unique "water entrance ceremony."
sentences.chinese: 這是一場別開生面的“水上入場式”。

sentences.english: His method of study was characteristic.
sentences.chinese: 他的學習方法是別開生面的。

sentences.english: Based on this, the thesis reviews Foucaults inimitable conception of power.
sentences.chinese: 在此基礎上，考察了福柯別開生面的權力觀。

sentences.english: Camel racing was held last Sunday in Berlin, capital of Germany.
sentences.chinese: 德國柏林25日舉行了一場別開生面的駱駝競技大賽。

sentences.english: Xu Wei's"freehand ink"painting techniques for the bird, spectacular dreams of.
sentences.chinese: 徐渭的潑墨寫意花鳥畫，別開生面自成一家。

definition: to make learning fun/to combine education and entertainment
joy of first experience (idiom)/the pleasure of reading sth for the first time
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
variant of 策劃|策划[ce4 hua4]
